name: Experimental Cell and Developmental Biology

prereqs.text: (03-343 [] at least D) and ((03-232 [] at least D) or (03-231 [] at least D)) and ((03-320 [] at least D) or (03-240 [] at least D))

long_desc: This laboratory is designed to teach concepts and experimental methods in cell and developmental biology. Students work with a variety of organisms to examine how cells traverse development from rapidly dividing, undifferentiated cells, through cell commitment and the establishment of spatial and temporal patterns of gene expression, to the specific characteristics and responses of terminally differentiated cells. The course makes extensive use of video microscopy with phase contrast, DIC and fluorescence microscopes. Biochemical, immunological and molecular biological techniques are used to probe the molecules and processes of cells undergoing development. Experimentation using living organisms andor their tissues, cells or molecules is an essential component of this course.

custom_fields.goals: You will work independently or in groups to investigate research questions in six different modules. Within each you will research background information, design a hypothesis, plan and carry out experiments, analyze and interpret your data, and propose future directions. You will communicate your results and background information in written reports or seminar presentations. The final research project will be designed and presented as a team in a poster session that hosts all of the undergraduate lab courses.
custom_fields.key_topics: Fluorescent proteins, cell cycle regulation, gene regulation during development, immunological techniques, neuronal morphology, cell culture
custom_fields.prerequisite_knowledge: Core concepts in cell biology, molecular biology techniques.
custom_fields.assessment_structure: Grades will be determned by written lab reports, seminar presentations, exams, quizzes, problem sets, attendance, and participation.
custom_fields.relevance: This course builds on skills learned in 03-343 to provide a laboratory research experience in the fields of cell and developmental biology. Students design projects, collect and analyze data, and present results in written and oral formats.
custom_fields.learning_resources: Students will be required to read the provided lab manual and provided scientific papers. Students will also search for primary literature to provide background information for reports and seminars.
custom_fields.extra_time_commitment: Students will be asked to briefly come to lab outside of class 2-3 times during the semester to further experimental work. In addition, one problem set will include a 1-hour article discussion session outside of scheduled class time.
